intro: Butomus junceus f. erectus, commonly known as the upright bulrush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, making it a striking feature in wetland environments. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense stands in shallow water or moist soil. Butomus junceus f. erectus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial wildlife.
